intro: Delphinium beesianum var. malacotrichum, commonly known as the Malacotrichum delphinium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that bear clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
